== About Purvesh Shah ==
Hi, I am {{https://launchpadlibrarian.net/54691562/Purvesh_Shah.png}} Purvesh R. Shah from Mumbai, <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maharashtra|Maharashtra State]]</nowiki>, India. <<BR>>
I am Web Designer and Geek.Computers have been part of my life from last four Year's. I like to help <nowiki>[[http://www.foss.in|FOSS]]</nowiki> & <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntu.com|Ubuntu]]</nowiki>. I am Ubuntu lover. Purvesh is also a staunch supporter of <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-l10n-gu|Ubuntu Gujarati Translation]]</nowiki> as well as he is the Owner of that team. He is also giving support on {{https://launchpad.net/@@/language}}#foss-gujarati, {{https://launchpad.net/@@/language}}##gujarati channel on network irc.freenode.net on IRC.

Purvesh likes to work with latest Technologies & he spend his time with Website Development, Social Computing and enjoys using internet and communication technology to bridge the digital divide.

My friend <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~warren-noronha|Warren Noronha]]</nowiki> introduce me to Ubuntu & my life changed. I am really Thankful to him, and what i am now it is because of Warren.

== Areas of Interests ==
Web Designing, <nowiki>[[http://www.drupal.org | Content Management System (CMS)]]</nowiki>, Research in Latest Technology, Extreme Programming, Digital Photography, Networking, helping Ubuntu & FOSS.

== Ubuntu Gujarati Translations ==
This group is responsible for translating the different variants and versions of Ubuntu in Gujarati. Read here for further information https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Ubuntu-Gujarati-Translators and subscribe to the mailing list, where you make your first translations prior to joining part of the team of translators. <<BR>>
For translation go to: <<BR>>
https://translations.launchpad.net/ubuntu/maverick/+lang/gu <<BR>>
https://translations.launchpad.net/loco-directory/trunk/+pots/loco-directory/gu/+translate <<BR>>
https://translations.edge.launchpad.net/ubuntu/maverick/+source/app-install-data-ubuntu/+pots/app-install-data/gu/+translate <<BR>>

== IRC ==

<nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_Relay_Chat|Internet Relay Chat (IRC)]]</nowiki> is a form of real-time Internet  text messaging (chat) or synchronous conferencing. It is mainly designed for group communication in discussion forums, called channels, but also allows one-to-one communication via private message as well as chat and data transfers via Direct Client-to-Client.

I am there always in #ubuntu channel in <nowiki>[[http://freenode.net/ | irc.freenode.net]]</nowiki> network.
And as time permits I hang around in some other channels too. You can find me in ##gujarati, #ubuntu-in, #linux-india, #drupal, ##php, #ubuntu-translators, #ubuntu-offtopic, #ubuntu-classroom and #ubuntu-classroom-chat channels.
